metadata.synopsis: Nina is a little girl who loved her big brother dearly. He was murdered by Dolor - the serial killer. She has some magic, and is desperately trying to bring her big brother back to life.

5.speaker: Nina Dortmell
5.text: The Mortarch is teaching me lots about death - and how it isn't that scary. She's a lot nicer than I thought.
5.context: NodeContext: a cautious smile, she's feeling much better

13.speaker: Nina Dortmell
13.text: Psst - keep a lookout. The Mortarch don't take kindly to raising the dead - but I won't be long, I promise.
13.context: NodeContext: Furtive, knows if she gets caught she'll be in big trouble. She's standing in front of a large gravesite.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Who are you raising from the dead?

2.speaker: Nina Dortmell
2.text: My big brother, Garret. He got killed by that murderer guy - but I'm gonna fix him. Now, keep watch!
2.context: NodeContext: holds her hands out in front of her, closes her eyes - read to cast

31.speaker: Nina Dortmell
31.text: Exaudi me, Myrkul! Resuscita fratrem meum. E morte ad me redige eo!
31.context: NodeContext: hands held out in front of her, frowning with concentration - clearly struggling with the spell, maybe tripping up a word or two

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *The air crackles with power - before fizzing out. The child has power but lacks control.*

47.speaker: Nina Dortmell
47.text: You're close, Myrkul - I can feel your shadow! Give my brother back, please.
47.context: NodeContext: drops her hands, frustrated, angry and upset

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Here - this scroll might do the trick.

53.speaker: Nina Dortmell
53.text: Really? I'm gonna try it right now!

38.speaker: Player
38.text: You need to focus your power - make it a sharpened point, like the tip of an arrow.

21.speaker: Nina Dortmell
21.context: NodeContext: raises her hands as if to cast a spell.

18.speaker: Nina Dortmell
18.text: That's dumb - I'm using magic, not a bow.
18.context: NodeContext: rolling her eyes - another dumb grown up wasting her time

41.speaker: Nina Dortmell
41.text: I'll figure it out by myself - thanks.
41.context: NodeContext: kinda surprised player is still standing there

14.speaker: Player
14.text: The spell you're looking for is 'Raise Undead'. This is how you do it...

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *She nods along, enraptured by your explanation.*

0.speaker: Nina Dortmell
0.text: Ohhh, that makes way more sense. Let me try again!
0.context: NodeContext: excited, raises her hands as if to cast a spell.

1.speaker: Nina Dortmell
1.text: Exaudi me, Myrkul! Resuscita fratrem meum. E morte ad me redige eo!
1.context: NodeContext: Hands held out in front of her at start of line. Much more confident and quick this time around. Powerful.

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *She blinks at your explanation, which involved hand gestures and five-syllable words.*

50.speaker: Nina Dortmell
50.text: That sounds dumb. And wrong. I'll figure it out on my own, thanks.
50.context: NodeContext: rolling her eyes - another dumb grown up wasting her time

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Your brother deserves to rest in peace - let him.

34.speaker: Nina Dortmell
34.text: The Mortarch said the same thing... but I miss him. A lot.
34.context: NodeContext: sad, but also knows the player is right

15.speaker: Nina Dortmell
15.text: Fine. I won't try again... for now, at least.
15.context: NodeContext: knows player is right - a little unhappy about it though

43.speaker: Nina Dortmell
43.text: No - he said we'd always have each other's backs. He promised! So butt. Out.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Raising a fallen creature? Paltry magic. Allow me to explain...

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Tell the child all you know of how fiends snatch souls from the afterlife.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Magic is about instinct. Trust you gut, trust your magic - and the rest will flow.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Your brother's soul is at rest - it is not fair to disturb it. Make peace with your dead, child.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Keep trying - you'll get it eventually.

39.speaker: Nina Dortmell
39.text: Oh, I'm not going anywhere - not until my brother is all right.
39.context: NodeContext: nodding, eager - glad tohave the player encouraging her

29.speaker: Player
29.text: That was dangerous! You must never do that again.

16.speaker: Nina Dortmell
16.text: I don't care what you say! I'm gonna save my brother!

6.speaker: Nina Dortmell
6.text: I'm coming Garret, just hang on.
6.context: NodeContext: holds her hands out in front of her, closes her eyes - read to cast

32.speaker: Player
32.text: You're just a child. Is this a good idea?

28.speaker: Nina Dortmell
28.text: Well it's this or cry - which isn't gonna help my big bro. Now, keep watch!
28.context: NodeContext: holds her hands out in front of her, closes her eyes - read to cast

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Whatever you're doing - stop it. Magic isn't a game.

37.speaker: Nina Dortmell
37.text: Urgh - you're worse than the Mortarch. Whatever.

19.speaker: Nina Dortmell
19.text: I ruined it - I ruined everything.
19.context: NodeContext: sees her brother garret, a broken skeleton, just in front of her. Upset, horrified, and heartbroken.

25.speaker: Nina Dortmell
25.text: I want you home, Garret - mam won't stop crying. And dad is always at the pub...
25.context: NodeContext: doesn't even see player - staring at the grave in front of her

57.speaker: Nina Dortmell
57.text: Hm. Maybe if I make the spell extra big. Uh, do you mind? I'm doing magic stuff.
57.context: NodeContext: first line said to herself - she has no idea what she's doing but she's gonna do her best. Sees player, doesn't know why they're standing there like a weirdo
